attributes.action: Change divorce law! Make "no fault" divorce possible.
attributes.background: No one wants to encourage a break up. But if couples talk the D-word, it is because the marriage is over. We need a simpler, administrative process that keeps kids safe and won't break the bank. It needs to help people, so they can put their kids first!
attributes.additional_details:
The law says you have to either divorce by waiting 2 years or 5 years OR you have to choose a reason like "adultery" or "unreasonable behaviour" or "desertion". 
"Why should it be easy? Kids need their parents to stay together" I hear you say...The trouble is, lawyers get round the divorce law very easily, but at great expense to their clients. Letters about petitions back and forth, outrage at the particulars, common sense out the window. ££££ for lawyers. Madness! Sign the petition to help.

attributes.action: Any future referendum vote on Scottish Independence must be given to all the UK.
attributes.background: The United Kingdom is exactly that..United.  As part of a legal union Scotland should NOT be able to decide alone on independence as the consequences will affect ALL of the UK economically and politically.

attributes.action: Establish a 7 day celebration of tireless efforts by NHS workers 365 days a year
attributes.background: My mum recently attended Hospital for a hip replacement where she was cared for by many wonderful NHS workers over a five day period including a weekend. I felt that my few words of appreciation to the staff needed reinforcing through a national campaign aimed at thanking all NHS workers in the UK.

attributes.action: Prevent privatisation of any aspect of Children's Protective Services in the UK
attributes.background: Children deserve to be protected by a system that is not privately controlled and therefore accountable to shareholders. Children's Protective Services must remain within Local Authority control as a Statutory Duty to protect children from avoidable harm.
attributes.additional_details:
Privitisation may allow confused prioritIes for providers that could lead to vulnerable children being abused.

We all have a duty to safeguard children which is a public necessity not a private and financial one.

attributes.action: Stop BT having the monopoly on installing phone lines so other providers can.
attributes.background: As consumers in this day and age we should be able to have options to use a company for a service or not. BT have not been able to provide myself and others on the estate with a phone line or internet services, myself since June 2016 others longer than 8 months
attributes.additional_details: some of the residents including myself on the estate have gone down the complaints route to the CEO and it's still not been resolved and no foreseeable dates for a resolution either. Only BT install phone lines then rent them to other providers. There is literally nothing any of us have been able to do. Every week we chase for an update to be told it's still being looked at. No dates no resolution and no phone line and Internet

attributes.action: Make our Waters Safe- Licensing and Alcohol Regulation of Watercraft
attributes.background: The Railways & Transportation Safety Act of 2003 in Section 80 already starts to cover the control of being under the influence, all it needs is to be signed by the Minister of Shipping (Robert Goodwill MP) for it to be enforced. This can then also be expanded into licensing watercraft.
attributes.additional_details:
British Waters are one of only a few that don’t require a license to operate leisure craft on the water, nor is there any regulation on being under the influence of alcohol or drugs. Most European countries, Australia and the USA all require a license to operate a vessel on the water. The US Coastguard name alcohol in their top five contributing factors of accidents. 
Lives at sea matter. We have legislation for our roads, why not our waters. 
For more info: www.facebook.com/makeourwaterssafe

attributes.action: Change the way in which property is bought and sold in England
attributes.background: My family and I have recently been left in a bad position, because of a supposedly reliable cash buyer pulling out of purchasing our flat, a week before we were going to be moving into our newly built family home.
attributes.additional_details: I would like a legally binding contract in place at an earlier stage (for example when a price is agreed) during the property buying and selling process. This will give the seller the confidence to start spending money on their next purchase, and not be worrying about if the buyer is going to back out. If a buyer then backs out without good reason then they will be liable for all the costs that the seller has incurred, and the buyer should also lose their deposit.

attributes.action: Urgently review age-based referrals for breast cancer screening women under 30.
attributes.background:
Under 30's automatically considered as non-urgent referral of up to 3 months.

Over 30's can expect to be seen within days/weeks.

Both can have same symptoms. 

This needs to change.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.edinburghnews.scotsman.com/news/health/mum-with-breast-cancer-urges-women-to-trust-their-instincts-1-4089771

https://www.gofundme.com/breastiesin20s

attributes.action: Stop the British Army disbanding the world's most famous Motorcycle Display Team
attributes.background: The team, the oldest and most famous motorcycle display team in the world, the White Helmets has made a considerable contribution over the years to the Army’s Community Engagement activities performing spectacular feats. The Army had decided to cut back and disband this Proud national treasure.
attributes.additional_details: Help show your support for this impressive British treasure that is internationally renowned and is a jewel in British military history by signing this petition. We should be proud and show our support for the forces and it's ability to engage with the people of the world and the white helmets are apart of the way we showcase our Armed Forces.

attributes.action: Payments to carers should be increased significantly.
attributes.background: Carers should be paid a decent living wage and not the pittance of £62.50 per week. Carers save the Government, billions of pounds a year. If all carers just gave up then there would not just be a crisis but total meltdown of social care. Carers should be cared for by the Government.

attributes.action: Take military action against the Syrian President Bashar al-Assad's Government.
attributes.background: 3 years ago, Parliament rejected a Gov. motion to take action against the Syrian Gov., after receiving evidence of the use of Chemical weapons against the Syrian people. We ask Parliament to reconsider its position following more recent reports of war crimes, including summary killings of civilians.
attributes.additional_details: In 2013, the UN confirmed that the Syrian Government had used chemical weapons against the Syrian people. In recent days there have been increased concerns that the Syrian army and their military supporters are committing both humanitarian and war crimes, including the massacring of families in cold blood. We urge Parliament to approve military action, in order to help in relieving Syrian civilians of their plight, and to deter the Syrian Government from committing such crimes against them.

attributes.action: Stop Govia Thameslink( GTR) from being allowed to increase fares in 2017
attributes.background:
Govia Thameslink the owners of Southern Rail have consistently failed to provide a service which could be considered acceptable in any reasonable way. 
With both individuals and businesses losing millions they should not be allowed to raise fares when they are not providing a proper service.
attributes.additional_details:
With well documented proof that they have consistently failed to provide a proper service, have left passengers stranded and have cost individuals & businesses millions in lost revenue collectively the owners of Southern Rail should have no automatic right to increase fares when they have failed miserably to provide an acceptable service for the last 8 months of 2016. 

This issue has been raised in the house several times and is public knowledge.

attributes.action: Initiate a Parliamentary Inquiry into the UK Insurance Industry
attributes.background:
The UK Insurance Industry operates under practices which are in direct contrast to the interests of its customers.
Involving multiple entities in any single claim increases costs which are passed on to the policy holder's insurer.  
Cases are settled to avoid costs in spite of no fault situations
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/money/blog/2012/sep/14/insurance-companies-defraud-us

http://www.thetimes.co.uk/tto/money/insurance/article4632734.ece

http://www.mindfulmoney.co.uk/mindful-news/an-end-to-auto-renewals-insurers-forced-to-provide-premium-comparison/

http://www.spectator.co.uk/2015/10/the-car-insurance-industry-is-a-disgusting-racket/

http://www.emeraldinsight.com/doi/abs/10.1016/S1529-2096%2806%2907002-7

http://uk.practicallaw.com/2-200-4590?q=&qp=&qo=&qe=

attributes.action: Get teachers in ALL schools more training on teaching kids with disabilities
attributes.background: My brother has autism spectrum disorder and went to many mainstream schools. He was bullied and taken advantage of by the kids and teachers never understood his meltdowns, having to come and get me. I think that ALL teachers, need to be trained and qualified on how to teach ALL types of children.
attributes.additional_details: Teaching kids, teenagers and adults with disabilities isn't rocket science. It just takes a bit of training and a lot of patience. Not only would it be great for the teachers to be able to teach both neurotypical and disabled children, but it would also help the children, they would feel more socially accepted and not put down by a disability they can't help thenselves having (or, as I see it, a gift too special for people to handle). Please help raise awareness and maybe get training in place.

attributes.action: Ask the Treasury to abolish the proposed company car tax changes.
attributes.background: The Government have pushed the public to buy "clean cars" via grants and tax breaks. Thousands of drivers including myself have followed their advice and incentives to purchase. They are now looking tax us for following their advice - The changes are unjust and a u-turn leaving us out of pocket.
attributes.additional_details:
Many of us have made the decision to buy a more expensive hybrid car because UKGOV asked us to by offering financial contributions and tax breaks. My family and I, (like many others) are now facing greater tax bills than I had with my previous diesel vehicle - How is this fair? I feel the public have been miss-sold and miss-guided by UKGOV. 

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3909606/Company-car-drivers-face-paying-thousands-tax-new-plans-announced-month.html

attributes.action: Remove Prescription Charges for Long-Term Physical/Mental Health Conditions
attributes.background:
In England you pay for prescriptions, unless you have an illness from a special list, or meet other criteria (eg age or max income/assets). This list was set in the 60s; cancer is the only new addition.

We call for those with illnesses lasting 6+ months to get free prescriptions for that illness.
attributes.additional_details:
Around 800,000 people skimp on medication for cost reasons (IPSOS MORI). This raises overall NHS costs. E.g. the cost of an A&E visit for worse asthma exceeds the cost of the drugs. The regime is unfair & out of date, leaving many risking their health.

Further reading: 	
- Gilmore Report: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/prescription-charges-review-the-gilmore-report
- https://www.asthma.org.uk/get-involved/campaigns/our-policy-work/prescription-charges
- http://bit.ly/prescharges

attributes.action: The UK government must condemn the Ethiopian government's treatment of the Oromo
attributes.background: We believe that the UK government should stop enabling the Ethiopian government and that they should support calls for an international, and independent investigation into the treatment of the Oromo people. Most recently this has lead to the death of 23 Oromo prisoners in a fire.
attributes.additional_details:
The Oromo people are the largest ethnic group in Ethiopia and make up 40% of the population. They have experienced discrimination at the hands of the government which has been dominated by the minority ethnic group Tigray for decades. 

The situation in Ethiopia has become increasingly unstable since security forces repeatedly fired upon protests in the Amhara and Oromia regions in August 2016. 

For more info: https://www.hrw.org/news/2016/09/08/joint-letter-un-human-rights-council-ethiopia

attributes.action: Enact schedule 6 of the 2009 Welfare Reform Act on Joint Birth Registration.
attributes.background: S.111 of the Adoption & Children Act 2002 demonstrated a turning point in Family Law, permitting unmarried fathers to obtain parental responsibility if their name is registered on their child's birth certificate. However, responsibility for registering the birth still lies mainly with the mother.
attributes.additional_details: In England & Wales every year around 7% of births are solely registered by mothers meaning upto 45,000 children do not have their father named on their birth certificate. Research shows that fathers' impact on their children is central to the child's healthy development. With rapidly changing social infrastructures there is a growing trend away from marriage and towards cohabitation. JBR will reinforce the important role fathers play in their children's lives, both practically and symbolically.

attributes.action: Government to Stop using private enterprise caterer and return military cooks
attributes.background: At present the services use private enterprise caterer such as Sodexo Catering Services. and the standard of food provided is not to a suitable standards.  and as the cost is increasing this situation should be rectified
attributes.additional_details: As members of the services are on a compulsory pay to dine scheme and it would appear their complaints are ignored. the government must take action.  The services have to have catering staff for service in areas of hostility these should also be in charge af army cook houses

attributes.action: Restrict Rail Franchise Owners paying excessive dividends when performance fails
attributes.background:
Some Train Operating Companies have fallen far short of their Public Performance Measures (PPM).

Simultaneously Franchise Owners - such as the Go Ahead Group - continue to pay material dividends that offer investors an attractive yield (e.g. 4-5%) which is 10 to 20 times the typical savings rate.
attributes.additional_details:
The PPM of the GoVia Thameslink Group (Southern, GEX and TL) is around 70% in 2016 so far - against the target for of around 86%. One in 3 trains is late.

The service that funds their dividends has failed to meet acceptable standards, and annual fare increases continue to be applied which contribute to that dividend.

This petition seeks to apply legislation that forces Franchise Owners to limit dividend distribution when PPM and other measures fall materially, and serially, short of target.

attributes.action: Additional EU Referendum for ALL Expats.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to implement a rule to trigger an additional EU Referendum for all expatriate British Citizens, regardless of the length of time they have resided outside the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details:
If implemented the result of the June 2016 EU Referendum means the United Kingdom would leave the World’s most influential network of nations on the base of a remarkably thin majority for such a huge step.
This is the decision of a lifetime to ALL British Citizens, wherever they live, yet the outcome was based on an undemocratic principle.
The millions of British citizens residing outside the UK are not only grass-roots ambassadors of the UK spread all over the planet but are affected by the result of the EU Referendum just as much as, if not more so, than UK residents.
However, millions of expats resident outside the UK for more than 15 years were not eligible to vote and were in effect disenfranchised. Therefore the result is not democratically legitimate.

attributes.action: Create a Fast Track immigration counter for UK BRP Card Holders at UK airports.
attributes.background: UK residents with a valid BRP card / visa should be allowed to use the fast track service at airports to enter the country apart from using the usual immigration counter.

attributes.action: child sex offenders not be allowed to apply for contact with their own children
attributes.background: After so many families having to deal with their child being sexually abused, I think that no family should have the added pressures and stress of the abusers applying for contact with any child they have parental responsibility for until investigations completed and sentences have been spent.
attributes.additional_details: 80% of child sexual abuse victims under 16 are abused by a family friend, family member or a person known to the family. These child sex offenders have a "right" to apply for contact with children they have parental responsibility for. This is wrong and change MUST happen now!!

attributes.action: Make children and young people in care's funding go up to the age of 21!
attributes.background: People who have been through the care system will understand....The need for support at 18 years old but none being accessible because there is no funding. We need to fight to change this!

attributes.action: No tolls on Mersey Gateway or Jubilee bridges for Halton residents.
attributes.background: Tolls on local bridges will cost Halton residents £1000 per year and will divide Runcorn and Widnes.
attributes.additional_details: This was reported by BBC North West news on Thursday 26th of January.

attributes.action: BLUE BADGES SHOULD BE GIVEN TO PEOPLE WHO ARE AUTISTIC
attributes.background: AUTISM SHOULD BE AN ELIGIBLE DISABILITY FOR A BLUE BADGE

attributes.action: Introduce a penny tax on plastic bottles
attributes.background: Plastic bottles our damaging out health. There are toxic chemicals in plastic bottles, including polycarbonates which are linked to conditions such as cancer and an increased risk of diabetes.  Many bottles are also then polluted and ultimately damage animals and contribute to climate change.
attributes.additional_details: There are now areas of sea across the world almost entirely covered in plastics, so often the result of thoughtless pollution of materials we consume readily every day - such as plastic bottles. This pollution has done great damage to the nature and sea and wildlife in areas where currents have taken these polluted materials. A charge would go some way to encouraging less pollution and as a result, less damage to our planet's natural environments and wildlife. It is also the case that many of the chemicals contained in plastic bottles are detrimental to both human and animal health; yet we consume these goods unknowingly and without due thought.

attributes.action: Ban homework in the UK
attributes.background: The children do plenty of work in school
attributes.additional_details: How are they supposed to eat, hang out with friends, do school clubs, bathe and get 8 hours of sleep when they have so much homework?

attributes.action: 25 Year Old and over to pay less than £2000 on car insurance
attributes.background: Over 25s should be paying less car insurance as they are unlikely to cause accidents by showing off on the roads they are more wiser and with more experience.

attributes.action: Raise pay for regular and reserve armed forces personnel
attributes.background: Our armed forces are underpaid and over worked we think that there minimum pay should be raised not just for regulars but also reserve units aswell
attributes.additional_details: I am an ex regular soldier and a serving reserve soldier in the army and I've seen first hand the state some of my muckers have been in having to budget for everything while risking there life if needs must to protect the uk and her inhabitants

attributes.action: Increase the standard paid length of Paternity Leave in the UK to 4 weeks.
attributes.background:
I have recently completed 2 weeks Paternity Leave after my first child was born. 
It really isn't enough time, the time it takes to properly bond with your child is vastly beyond what is currently allowed. 
It should be totally optional but I believe the government should increase the paid time.

attributes.action: Send aid and health trained volunteers into Aleppo to help with current crisis.
attributes.background: Aleppo deserves help, we have already turned our backs once before by making it clear England doesn't want refugees, bombing needs to stop. There is no hospitals left. It's a human rights violation. send them aid- medicine, shelter, food, drink, clothes and volunteers trained in health care
attributes.additional_details: Every single day people are dying in Aleppo. Watch the news

attributes.action: Double the free child care hours for working parents or single working parent.
attributes.background:
More than one in four UK business leaders say employees have cut their hours because of the "high cost of childcare", a report from the British Chambers of Commerce says.

The government wants to have a lower unemployment rate, so they should consider things like this.
attributes.additional_details: UK jobless rate declined to 4.8 percent in the three months to September 2016 from 4.9 percent in the April to June period and 5.3 percent a year earlier. This could be changed if they helped us with child care costs!

attributes.action: Continue the Rail Electrification Works between Cardiff and London via Bristol
attributes.background:
On 8th November, it has been reported that electrification works on the railways between Cardiff and London via Bristol, among other works, will be arbitrarily and indefinitely delayed from the previous schedule.

This is an insult to the people of Bristol, Wales and the South West.
attributes.additional_details:
"Costly and disruptive electrification works" have already been underway in Bristol and the Severn Tunnel. To delay capitalizing on the progress that has already been made is to ask the region to absorb the economic penalties from those works without view of payback in improved service.

We urge the minister Paul Maynard to honour his party's manifesto pledge, reconsider this decision and continue with the works as planned.

https://goo.gl/IpVbRY

https://goo.gl/osNOoe

attributes.action: Immediate ban on unregulated Private Parking companies from accessing DVLA data.
attributes.background:
Citizens Advice recently reported a dramatic rise in people seeking help about penalties for parking on private land – trebling from 16,300 to 50,000.
They should be forced to install parking barriers not Aprn cameras.
attributes.additional_details:
The injustice of heavy fines for small parking errors.
Victim’s mental wellbeing is never a concern.
They've mastered to make life difficult for drivers.
A group of private car parking companies threatened to take moneysaving expert to court an attempt to stop them from telling consumers their legitimate rights.
According to the DVLA, private parking operators have requested  details of drivers more than three million times in the last year, which has increased from 2.4 million the year before.

attributes.action: Make it legal that disabled people travelling in wheelchairs need a head rest
attributes.background: I would like to make it legal for all disabled people travelling in wheelchairs to have a head rest for safety reasons. All car seats now have head rests and children in car seats must have head/neck support so why discriminate a disabled person by not supplying them with head/neck support.
attributes.additional_details: Please help by signing this petition

attributes.action: Establish a list of acredited Business Consultants/Mentor organisations.
attributes.background: Business Consultants offer valuable advice to government and SMEs yet remain unregulated.  It is proposed that when engaging, recommending, or working with Business Consultants government bodies and SMEs should be able to refer to an approved provider list of organisations and agencies.
attributes.additional_details: SMEs are seen as the growth engine of the economy yet there is little information for the inexperienced to identify who are credible business consultants and who are not.  There is no overarching governance mechanism, and yet we see numerous initiatives and grants seeking to help this sector. To this extent making available a list of accrediting organisations who exercise not only a quality control scheme for their members but ongoing educational programmes, for example as offered by, the Association of Business Mentor (a body of professional mentors) or such organisations as ibd Business Advice Group (ibd-uk.com – a group of business consultants) would protect both end user and provider.

attributes.action: To grant leave to remain in the UK for my wife whom I'm married for 26 years.
attributes.background: I married to my wife a Singapore citizen for 26 years and have two children born in the UK and I am a UK citizen, we submitted many application over 18 years for Visa for my wife to remain in the UK but all was rejected(6 in all)After many tries and different forms the application is rejected again.
attributes.additional_details: I have medical problems and had two operations in 3 months and need someone to look after me and also suffering from depression.I have wasted most of my savings paying for the applications and recent application had to be submitted with medical insurance and the price has gone up for new applications.My family life has been ruined because of this and my kids grew up not knowing their mother well.We have a grandchild who was born April of this year.We have a right to be together.

attributes.action: Ban cyclists using mobile phones whilst actively riding.
attributes.background: It has become evident, that there is an increasing number of cyclists on UK roads, pavements and cycle ways, utilising their mobile phones whilst actively riding. Not only are they putting themselves and pedestrians at risk, but the driver of road vehicles.
attributes.additional_details: If there were to be an accident involving a car and cyclist, the motorist would face consequences due to damage caused. There is an increasing call for drivers to be safer when it comes to cyclists, and the way in which they use the road (eg passing with enough space) but how do we guard against unsafe cyclists on their mobile devices, taking a call and/or sending a message. It is unsafe for a motorist and therefore unsafe for a cyclist.

attributes.action: Make prescriptions free for people with Crohns, Ulcerative Colitis
attributes.background: I suffer with this and I have to pay £104 a year for medication and that's with a prepayment prescription card. I can't live without this medication and I can get extremely poorly to the point hospital is required. I think this should be made free.

attributes.action: Standardise child age groups where there is an entrance fee. 18+ is adult
attributes.background: I believe pricing of  attractions should be fair. And having to pay adult prices to gain entry to attractions, shows, holidays. Flight's etc for anyone under 18 is wrong. When you have a young family it is becoming increasingly expensive to do anything when you have to pay full price adult children
attributes.additional_details: Alton Towers Adult prices start at 12+ since when have 12 year old been adults. This is one example of countless organisations and companies that routinely choose thier own age limits for pricing. We need a country if not worldwide pricing structure so parents don't get ripped off

attributes.action: Provide asylum for LGBTQ+ refugees affected by Trumps travel ban.
attributes.background: Trump's ban on refugees in the US will have a devastating effect on LGBTQ+ people seeking refuge. It will impact LGBTQ+ asylum seekers and refugees already living in the US. We call on the UK government to uphold Britain's outstanding respect for, and protection of, LGBTQ+ people and rights.
attributes.additional_details: Trump's ban on refugees will disproportionately affect LGBTQ+ refugees and asylum seekers. The UK has an enviable cultural and legal stance that protects LGBTQ+ people. Helping people from this community that will face extreme danger would not only uphold our values as a nation, but send a strong message to the Trump administration that we do not accept his persecution of marginalised communities. We ask the UK government to extend a welcome and provide protection to communities seeking asylum.

attributes.action: The UK Government must commit to publicly destroying all stockpiled ivory.
attributes.background: Between 2009 and 2014, 40% of all illegal wildlife seizures made by the UK’s Border Force were ivory items. In 2015, 110kg of ivory were captured at Heathrow airport in one of the UK’s largest seizures of illegal ivory. We call on the UK Government to commit to destroying any stockpiles of ivory.
attributes.additional_details: Publicly destroying ivory stockpiles will raise awareness that the $20bn annual illegal wildlife trade is the 4th largest global illegal activity. This action will send a clear message to the world that the UK will not tolerate illegal trafficking and commercial trade in any raw or worked ivory and that we support a near total ban on domestic ivory trade. Most importantly, it will emphasise to current and future generations that ivory is worthless unless it is on wild living elephants.

attributes.action: Introduce rent caps on private let & prevent landlords refusing Housing Benefit
attributes.background: Currently in the SE private rents have become ridiculous, with  a single room costing as much as £700 pm. This is useless to a largely working class area. To add to this most letting agents and landlords refuse to accept any form of housing benefit, even as a top up.
attributes.additional_details: I would as that we stop the practice of refusing to accept tenants with housing benefit and ask that we put caps on how much rent can be charged. £1400 pm for a house is impossibly high! This requires you to be earning £34,000 and pay almost £3000 up front (figures on a recent viewing of a property) The average UK wage of £26,500 would not cover this. We have houses. People simply cannot afford them! I would also ask they they stop houses being split into rooms for rental reducing family homes.

attributes.action: A legal aid framework for victims in the case of IVP dataset compromises.
attributes.background: The Investigatory Powers Bill requires the creation of huge datasets of citizens online activity. These datasets will be a very tempting target for criminals. The Government should create a legal aid framework that will help any victims in the case of these datasets being compromised.
attributes.additional_details: We realise that as much attention to security will be given as possible in terms of protecting the hardware and the software protecting this data. This does not mean however that a compromise is not possible and attention needs to be given to what will happen in the event of a compromise and what aid can be given to victims. The framework for this aid should be discussed and a framework formalised in advance so that it is clear to each citizen what help and redress they may seek.

attributes.action: Make it an offence to desecrate National flags or symbols of National importance
attributes.background: Recent events such as the burning of poppies during the remembrance parades have caused anger and division in our society.  Such acts are offensive to the majority of UK citizens and are completely unacceptable in a civilised society such as ours.
attributes.additional_details: The burning or desecration of any of the UK National flags is deeply offensive to a large majority of UK citizens as is burning or destroying of poppies during the period when such symbols are worn to honour the fallen.  We, the petitioners demand that such acts be classed as hate crimes and that the offenders be prosecuted accordingly under the appropriate legislation.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of domestic fireworks for gardens above 85db.
attributes.background: Every year people's pets and children are disturbed by the noise of fireworks for weeks on end around bonfire night. Make it illegal to sell fireworks about 85db to the general public, this is the noise level that is used in measuring noisy environments causing hearing loss.
attributes.additional_details: Fireworks produce a sound output that is in the 150 to 175 decibel range. There is medical evidence that each year, many people experience some damage to their hearing as a result of fireworks. On top of this many animal owners have to sedate cats & dogs, baby birds and rabbits can die of the shock and elderly people find it alarming especially if they live on their own. Displays in gardens pose a much higher problem that organised ones where people are more prepared for their level of noise.

attributes.action: Reform the Misuse of Drugs Act
attributes.background:
We call upon the government to recognise that the “War on Drugs” has been a complete failure and that people will always take drugs regardless of the law.

We believe that all currently illegal drugs must be decriminalised with certain recreational drugs such as Cannabis being legalised completely
attributes.additional_details:
By continuing with our current war on drugs, we are facilitating criminal enterprises and causing the death of thousands of users through fake, dangerously cut drugs or synthetic replacements (So called Legal High’s).

We also need a new approach especially with the legalisation of Marijuana in certain US states and potentially the whole of Canada (in 2017). 

The world is changing. The criminals are happy with the current law, but we feel that it’s time to reform our 1970’s approach to drugs.

attributes.action: Make the 5p bag charge go towards the NHS.
attributes.background: I think a better use for the 5p bag charge will be to donate the money to our crippled NHS .

attributes.action: Raise teachers' pay
attributes.background: Teachers are the backbone of society and there would be no future without them. Yet they so undervalued and undermined within society and do not receive a high enough wage.
